comment: There is a reason why David Beam has a 5 star rating on this site. It was simply a joy to be in this class. The course is very helpful if you are wanting to get into law enforcement. If you are taking it as an elective you will not regret it! Show up and pay attention and you will get an A. I only wish he taught more CRJU courses!

Professor Beam was great! He is a deputy for Marietta Police Department. He has about 30 years of police experience so he knows what he's talking about. The class has 3 grades midterm, paper, and final. He also gives extra credit for going to the writing center, even if it is for another class. He also offers a bonus paper. Great class!

Great professor, knows exactly what he is talking about and how to teach a class correctly. Class barely ever went over 45 minutes. He cares for his students and is willing to do anything to help you. Take him!!

He is a police officer but you can tell he is one of the good ones. He teaches you what you need to know and doesn't make you stay any longer than necessary. He says exactly what you need to go over for the tests and will help you if you need it. The papers are based solely on grammar and punctuation not on the content so they are pretty easy.

He is a very good professor and I would recommend you take his class.  He is a local police officer and really knows his stuff.  The material is not overly hard as long as you pay attention and study.  He does have an attendance requirement.

This is the best teacher ever!!  He makes learning fun and manageable.  Mr. Beam reminded me that amidst of all of the negative incidences happening  in the country right now involving police officers, there are a few that are clearly good police officers.  He provides good advice on a regular basis as well.

Mr. Beam is one of the best professors I've had by far.  He set the bar high for other professors. We only had 2 test and the final. All of which were multiple choice.  He lectures but everything that's on the test comes directly from the book. I left the class with a plethora of information. I suggest taking this class with hardcore courses. A+
Great guy. Really enjoyed his class. By the end of the semester I wanted to become a cop lol take him! You will not be disappointed

Awesome is the best way to describe this class. I looked forward to attending class.  Hats off to KSU for finding such an outstanding and caring professor. I took his class Spring semester. I hope he will teach more classes. Class is an easy A if you listen in class and study his power point.  He knows how to hold your attention.

He is Deputy Sheriff in Marietta and changed my mind about police enforcement. He brought in officers from every area of his precinct-SWAT, Employement Director, Training etc. AWESOME at making material interesting and providing all the necessary material for tests.Book not required to make an A. Show up to class and you will get it no problem.

Best professor ever. He is helpful and kind, and the material is easy. 3 assignments... midterm, research paper and final. Tests are easy A's if you go to class/look at the powerpoints, and he grades the papers extremely easy. Take him, you'll love him. I'd take the class again if I could!
What can I say.  How about best class ever?  Yeah.. best class ever.

Awesome teacher. 3 assignments, two tests and 1 paper, 1 optional paper for 5 pts on overall grade. Do not buy book, just print powerpoints. Lots of cool guest speakers! Attendance NOT mandatory, but get extra points for going to class. Easy A very nice. Sheriff of Marietta Police Department. Will cancel class if all material is covered.

He is one of the awesomest professors EVER!!! Attendance is not mandatory but he gives you extra credit if you missl ess than 5. Love the class; it was very interesting and funny. We had alot of other real-life cop guest speakers. Grade is made out of a midterm, a research paper, and a final. But his tests are cake if you even look at powerpoints.

This guy is a great teacher. It's the funnest class I've ever been in. I'm a CJ major, but this guy can make CJ interesting to anybody. He's a cheif deputy police officer for Marietta PD and as worked there for 25 years so he knows his stuff. Has guest presentations often. If you pay attention, you will get an A!

Best professor ever! I have never rated a prof on here, but I had to for him. He's super nice and awesome! Answers everything to the best of his knowledge, and he knows the material is kinda dry so he tries to make the class more humorous. Tests come straight from the powerpoints. He is a must take!

DO NOT BUY THE BOOK! Questions come straight from the power point, and he'll hint to you what you will see again. Attendance is not mandatory, but class is always interesting. 2 exams, 1 5 page paper. Gives extra credit questions on exam from guest speakers. If we finish a chapter early, he will often cancel the next class. Highly recommend.

Great Teacher!!! Loves what he does and he makes the class really interesting. He has guest come in from time to time which was really fun, tests come straight from the power points he has and there all multiple choice with bonus questions. I would recommend anyone to take his class it was great!

Mr.Beam has to be the best professor ever! He keeps everything interesting and is so nice.He has a great sense of humor and is always willing to take time to answer his students question. As far as his class goes, it is easy and takes minimal effort to make an A.
He uses powerpoint and is very interesting.  The class really gets some good discussions going.  I enjoyed his class more than any I took last semester.

Professor Beam is a cop and really knows his stuff about criminal justice.  He answers questions about any legal subject that comes up.  He gives fair exams and very clear lectures.  He requires a paper but it's not too hard if you put a good paper together.  He does take attendance and gives bonus points to those who come to class.  I really, real

This was the easiest class I've taken in my life. Super easy teacher that doesn't require you to come to class. However, he is really fun and lets you ask any questions you want about cops and law so class is very interesting.

Professor Beam is hands down the best professor at KSU! He is extremely helpful and relates criminal justice to everyday life. Tests are straight forward and he has his powerpoints on vista. Such a good professor!
